title: CLSU College Admission Test Online Application System
summary: A web-based application system that enables prospective students to apply for the CLSU College Admission Test by submitting personal information, academic details, and required documents online. The system streamlines the application process, improves data accuracy, and supports efficient admission screening.
description: Built and maintained the CLSU College Admission Test Online Application System using PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, and REST APIs, transforming the process from a manual, paper-based workflow to a fully digital platform. Developed a seamless, mobile-first online application process, enabling prospective students to submit application form and required documents, and receive their test permits online. Integrated the Gemini AI API for photo verification to ensure applicants met strict ID photo requirements. Optimized the system for accessibility and usability, reducing on-site queues and increasing annual applicants from 8,000+ to over 20,000+. Additionally, the system supports administrators by automating UNIFast application forms, generating reports, and providing real-time dashboard analytics for faster and more efficient admission processing.
contributions: Designed and developed the entire system using PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, and REST API.
Built an end-to-end online application workflow, replacing manual, paper-based submissions.
Integrated Gemini AI API for AI-powered photo verification to ensure applicants met strict ID photo requirements.
Optimized user experience for accessibility, reducing manual workload and eliminating long queues.
impact: Increased the number of applicants each year, breaking all-time student application records.

title: CLSU Thesis/Dissertation Formatting Systems
summary: A document processing tool that automatically applied official university formatting guidelines to academic manuscripts.
description: Designed, developed, and deployed a document processing system using Laravel that automatically applies official university formatting guidelines to academic theses and research papers. The system generates an editable Word (DOCX) document based on an approved university template, allowing students to bootstrap their manuscripts while retaining full control for final revisions.
Implemented a rich text editor that mimics common word-processing tools found in Microsoft Word, enabling users to structure and format content directly within the system.
Integrated secure external storage to safely handle file uploads within the editor, and added dashboard analytics to monitor system usage and reports.
Due to inherent limitations in automated formatting—particularly for tables and figures—the system encourages users to review and refine the generated document prior to final submission.
contributions: Built a formatting system with Laravel, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, and REST API.
Enabled students to create manuscripts and instantly generate format-compliant versions, removing dependency on third-party formatting services.
Reduced faculty review time by ensuring submissions adhered to official formatting requirements.
impact: Eliminated the need for students to pay third-party services for thesis formatting.

title: CLSU Faculty Performance Evaluation System
summary: A web-based system designed to automate faculty performance evaluation by recording and managing evaluation data. The system improves efficiency, ensures data consistency, and supports academic decision-making.
description: Maintained and enhanced the existing CLSU Faculty Performance Evaluation System, improving UI/UX design and implementing a mobile-first experience' to better support faculty and student end-users. Optimized database performance through strategic indexing and query improvements, resulting in faster system response times and significantly improved report generation. Delivered real-time evaluation reports that reduced manual processing for administrators and enabled faster, data-driven decision-making. As part of a legacy system enhancement, integrated an AI-powered feature (Gemini AI API) to summarize evaluation comments, making it easier to identify faculty strengths and areas for improvement.

Later on, developed a newer version of the system aligned with updated CHED guidelines, using modernized technologies built with Laravel. Redesigned the database structure and system architecture with an emphasis on data integrity, scalability, and long-term maintainability, resulting in a robust and future-ready evaluation platform.
contributions: Rebuilt and maintained the evaluation platform using Laravel, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, and REST API.
Designed and implemented a normalized database schema for scalability and improved performance.
Delivered real-time evaluation reports, reducing manual work for administrators and improving decision-making.
(Legacy System Contribution) Integrated Gemini AI API to summarize faculty evaluation feedback, enhancing report readability.
impact: Streamlined evaluation workflow and improved accessibility of faculty evaluation data.
